verses.text: If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams arises among you and gives you a sign or a wonder,
verses.comment: This verse introduces the test of prophecy and miraculous signs. Genuine faith requires discernment, not just amazement at signs. Compare to Jesus’ warnings about false prophets (Matthew 7:15).

verses.text: and the sign or the wonder comes to pass, of which he spoke to you, saying, ‘Let us go after other gods,’ which you have not known, and let us serve them,
verses.comment: Miracles or fulfilled signs alone do not prove divine authority if they lead people away from the worship of the one true God. Spiritual fidelity is always linked to sound teaching.

verses.text: you must not listen to the words of that prophet or dreamer of dreams. For the LORD your God is testing you, to know whether you love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.comment: God allows false prophets to appear as a test of loyalty and love for Him. True love for God means following truth above all. This anticipates Jesus’ teaching to love God with all one’s heart (Mark 12:30).

verses.text: You shall walk after the LORD your God and fear Him and keep His commandments and obey His voice. You shall serve Him and cling to Him.
verses.comment: ‘Cling to Him’ signifies a deep, covenantal relationship, similar to the spiritual union emphasized by Jesus in John 15:4. True obedience means remaining faithful even in temptation.

verses.text: But that prophet or dreamer of dreams must be put to death, because he has taught rebellion against the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and redeemed you out of the house of slavery, to lead you astray from the way the LORD your God commanded you to walk. So you shall purge the evil from among you.
verses.comment: Capital punishment showed the seriousness of leading others into idolatry. In the New Testament, Christ fulfills the Law and teaches purifying the community through grace and discipline (Matt. 18:8-9).

verses.text: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son or your daughter, or the wife you embrace, or your friend who is as your own soul, entices you secretly, saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods,’ which neither you nor your fathers have known,
verses.comment: The call to faithfulness extends even above the closest earthly relationships, echoing Jesus’ demand for loyalty above family (Matt. 10:37).

verses.text: namely, of the gods of the peoples who are around you, whether near or far from you, from one end of the earth to the other,
verses.comment: Idolatry comes in many forms, both near and far. The command covers all false worship, not only local traditions, but anything contrary to the faith handed down.

verses.text: you shall not yield to him or listen to him. Your eye must not pity him, nor shall you spare him or conceal him.
verses.comment: Even compassion must not outweigh truth. Loyalty to God is above human emotion if it means denying His commandments.

verses.text: But you shall surely put him to death; your hand shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterwards the hand of all the people.
verses.comment: The accuser must cast the first stone, emphasizing the gravity of bearing witness. In John 8:7, Jesus shifts from literal execution to the greater call for grace and repentance.

verses.text: You must stone him to death with stones, because he sought to draw you away from the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.comment: Drawing away others from God was a capital crime, reflecting the necessity to preserve the unity and purity of worship. See the spiritual fulfillment in Acts 7:39, where turning from God leads to judgment.

verses.text: Then all Israel shall hear and fear and never again do any such evil as this among you.
verses.comment: Public discipline serves as a warning to the whole community. Compare this with the fear that fell on the church after the discipline of Ananias and Sapphira (Acts 5:11).

verses.text: If you hear in one of your cities, which the LORD your God gives you to dwell there,
verses.comment: Extending the call for vigilance to the entire community, not just individuals. Responsibility for holiness is communal, not private alone.

verses.text: that certain worthless men have gone out from among you and led the inhabitants of their city astray, saying, ‘Let us go and serve other gods’—which you have not known—
verses.comment: "Worthless men"—those who corrupt the community's faith—are condemned for leading others astray. Spiritual leaders later are called to guard the faith from corruption (see Titus 1:9).

verses.text: then you shall inquire, investigate, and ask diligently; and if it is true and certain that such an abomination has been done among you,
verses.comment: Righteous judgment must be based on diligent investigation to avoid injustice. Honest inquiry is essential, echoed in New Testament calls to impartial judgment (1 Tim. 5:19-21).

verses.text: you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the sword, devoting it to destruction—all who are in it and its livestock—with the edge of the sword.
verses.comment: "Devoting to destruction" is the language of total consecration for justice. Mercy and justice are held together, reflecting God’s holiness. Compare Joshua 6:21 in Jericho’s destruction.

verses.text: You shall gather all its spoil into the middle of its open square and burn the city and all its spoil with fire, as a whole burnt offering to the LORD your God. It shall be a heap forever. It shall never be rebuilt.
verses.comment: Destruction and burnt offering symbolize the eradication of evil for purification. Spiritual meaning: the faithful are called to radical detachment from sin, offering all to God.

verses.text: None of the devoted things shall cling to your hand, so that the LORD may turn from the fierceness of His anger and show you mercy, have compassion on you, and multiply you, just as He promised to your fathers,
verses.comment: Obedience and detachment from forbidden things results in mercy and blessing. God’s promises to Abraham are recalled, and blessings flow through faithful obedience.

verses.text: if you obey the voice of the LORD your God by keeping all His commandments that I am commanding you today, and do what is right in the eyes of the LORD your God.
verses.comment: Doing what is right in the sight of God means full obedience, not just outward acts. Christ interprets obedience as love for God (John 14:15). The call to unity and pure faith is underscored throughout Scripture.
